{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3161803,"name":"Ed Peters","username":"epeters1111","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/epeters1111/{size}/182731_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-10T17:38:44.522Z","cooked":"

We’re currently not using AdvantageKit or anything fancy, and just publishing metrics via SmartDashboard. Circa two years ago, we would generally use stuff like SmartDashboard.putNumber to publish metrics in the periodic loop, or in code call from it. Since then, we’ve trended towards publishing a custom Sendable in the constructor of each subsystem.

I think this is better because it doesn’t clutter up the periodic loop with those calls - we’re certainly seeing fewer warnings about overruns. I suspect that Sendable instances may be polled in a background thread. Can anyone confirm?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-03-10T17:38:44.522Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":36.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429732,"topic_slug":"best-place-for-metrics","display_username":"Ed Peters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56650,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/best-place-for-metrics/429732/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3161931,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-10T21:09:12.188Z","cooked":"

Sendables are not polled from a background thread, they’re polled as part of the main periodic loop as follows:

  • IterativeRobotBase.loopFunc() →
  • SmartDashboard.updateValues() →
  • SendableRegistry.update() for each sendable →
  • SendableBuilderImpl.update() →
  • update() on each property →
  • updateNetwork() if it’s a setter →
  • getter.get(), and the result passed to NT publisher set() function

The call trace for putNumber to NT is actually a lot shorter, except it does a string lookup; you can avoid this lookup by creating/using a NT publisher instead (e.g. DoublePublisher or similar).
